articles.title: Kim Jong Il Enjoys Performance Given by Russian Academy Ensemble
articles.content:
Kim Jong Il Enjoys Performance Given by Russian Academy Ensemble
Pyongyang, October 18 (KCNA) -- General Secretary Kim Jong Il together with servicepersons of the KPA enjoyed a performance given on Saturday by the Academy Ensemble of the Interior Unit of the Russian Ministry of Interior, on a visit to the DPRK.
					 He was greeted at the theatre by Victor Yeliseev, chief of the ensemble, and Valery Sukhinin, Russian ambassador to the DPRK, and other official diplomats of the embassy.
					
					 Kim Jong Il warmly welcomed the ensemble's visit to the DPRK and expressed thanks for its enthusiastic performances given in Pyongyang and local area pleasing the servicepersons and people of the DPRK marking the 64th birthday of the WPK. He had a friendly talk with the guests.
					
					 When he appeared in the auditorium, the whole audience enthusiastically welcomed him.
					
					 Among the audience were Choe Thae Bok and Kim Ki Nam, secretaries of the Central Committee of the WPK, and its senior officials including its department directors and first vice department directors, Ju Sang Song, minister of People's Security, Kang Sok Ju, first vice-minister of Foreign Affairs, KPA Generals Hyon Chol Hae and Ri Myong Su and other commanding officers of the KPA.
					
					 The performance began with chorus "Song of General Kim Il Sung". Put on the stage were such colorful numbers as male solo and chorus "Return to Sorento", female solo and chorus "Looking at Blue Lake", dance "Dance of Russian Holiday", Korean song "My Blessed Life" and male solo and chorus "Eternal Friends of DPRK and Russia" which was specially created for its performance tour of the DPRK.
					
					 The performers truthfully represented the ardent love of the army and people of Russia for the country, their optimistic life and national emotion with high artistry. 
					
					 The performance ended with chorus "Song of General Kim Jong Il". 
					
					 Kim Jong Il sent a floral basket to the performers congratulating them on their successful performance.

articles.title: DPRK's Efforts for Peace in Korean Peninsula Reiterated
articles.content:
DPRK's Efforts for Peace in Korean Peninsula Reiterated
 Pyongyang, October 18 (KCNA) -- The DPRK will in the future, too, make every possible effort to ensure peace and security in Asian region including the Korean Peninsula. A delegate of the DPRK said this at the meeting of the First Committee of the 64th UN General Assembly held on October 12.
					 He noted that the DPRK demands total and comprehensive elimination of nuclear weapons in the world. 
					
					 When the states with the largest nuclear arsenals take the lead in nuclear disarmament, it will positively influence the newly emerged nuclear weapons states in various parts of the world and also contribute to total elimination of nuclear weapons on this globe, he noted.
					
					 He drew the attendants' attention to the questions as to when and by whom nuclear weapons were deployed for the first time on the Korean Peninsula, who is blackmailing with nukes and what kind of role is the NPT playing as regards the above-mentioned nuclear weapons states and what is the real nature of the nuclear issue on the Korean Peninsula. 
					
					 The speaker went on:
					
					 If the Korean Peninsula is to be denuclearized, the U.S. should terminate its nuclear threat to the DPRK and definitely roll back its hostile policy toward the latter.
					
					 Replacing the Korean Armistice Agreement with a peace arrangement is essential for peace and the reunification of the Korean Peninsula and peace and security in Northeast Asia and the rest of the world.
					
					 The role of disarmament machinery is increasingly important in the international efforts for world peace and security. In particular, the First Committee should enhance its role in nuclear disarmament as an organ dealing with disarmament issues. This should find its expression in disarmament issues first of all.
					
					 The DPRK, as a member state of the UN Disarmament Conference in Geneva, the unique disarmament negotiating body in the UN, recognizes that it is the most useful one to promote the global disarmament.

articles.title: Wreaths Laid before Grave of Ri Po Ik
articles.content:
Wreaths Laid before Grave of Ri Po Ik
 Pyongyang, October 18 (KCNA) -- Wreaths were placed before the grave of ardent patriot Ri Po Ik in Mangyongdae Sunday on the occasion of the 50th anniversary of her death.
					 Seen standing before the grave was a wreath sent by Kim Jong Il, general secretary of the Workers' Party of Korea, chairman of the National Defence Commission of the DPRK and supreme commander of the Korean People's Army.
					
					 Present at the wreath-laying ceremony were Kim Yong Nam, O Kuk Ryol, Choe Yong Rim and others and officials of party, armed forces and power organs, working people's organizations and ministries and national institutions, servicepersons of the KPA and working people in Pyongyang. 
					
					 Wreaths were placed before her grave in the name of the WPK Central Committee, ministries and national institutions, public organizations, scientific and educational institutions, military universities and party and power organs, industrial establishments and farms in Pyongyang. 
					
					 The participants observed a moment's silence in the memory of the noble life of Ri Po Ik who, guided by the anti-Japanese patriotic idea in the period of the nation's sufferings, let members of her family embark upon the road of a revolutionary struggle to glorify the tradition of the Mangyongdae family and dedicated herself to the country and people.

articles.title: Japan Urged to Settle Its Past Crimes
articles.content:
Japan Urged to Settle Its Past Crimes
 Pyongyang, October 18 (KCNA) -- Japan is seeking to evade the settlement of the war crimes committed by it in the past, feigning ignorance of them and turning its face from those crimes. These crimes will never be tolerated by the world as they are criminal acts of mocking at the justice and human conscience and challenging history. Rodong Sinmun Sunday says this in a signed article.
					 It goes on: 
					
					 The Japanese reactionaries are so deeply steeped in the militarist way of thinking that they hesitate to make a proper assessment of the past war crimes even today when more than six decades have passed since their defeat in the war and are not ready to turn over a new leaf in history. 
					
					 They have not paid any reparation to the Korean people who suffered the greatest loss at the hands of the Japanese imperialists in the past and harbor bitterness toward Japan. Worse still, they are raising irrelevant issues in a foolish bid to gloss over the crimes Japan committed against Korea by invading it. 
					
					 The DPRK-Japan relations of hostility will never be thawed but deteriorate if Japan continues denying its past aggression of Korea and distorting its history and evading reparation for its crimes.
					
					 Japan should honestly admit its past crimes and opt for settling them both in the light of the gravity of the crimes and human sense of obligation.
					
					 It is quite evident that the longer Japan, which claims to be an economic power, has its inglorious past unsettled, the further its image will be tarnished and the more bitterly it will be censured in the international arena.
					
					 Japan is sadly mistaken if it calculates the past crimes committed by it against the Korean people will be played down or written off with the passage of time. 
					
					 Japan would be well advised to settle all its wrongs done in the last century from a proper stand and attitude toward the past war crimes and make a new appearance before the world. This is not something to be done by Japan for others but its historic responsibility it should fulfill for its own sake.

articles.title: Earlier Country's Reunification Called for
articles.content:
Earlier Country's Reunification Called for
 Pyongyang, October 18 (KCNA) -- It is an urgent and vital historic cause of the nation and the noblest duty of the Koreans to reunify the country.
					 Rodong Sinmun Sunday observes this in a signed article.
					
					 It goes on:
					
					 Reunifying Korea is an issue of terminating outsiders' domination and interference in the internal affairs of south Korea and fully realizing the sovereignty of the nation and achieving the national unity. 
					
					 Unspeakable are the sufferings and misfortune the Koreans are undergoing due to the territorial partition and the national split, the article notes, and goes on: 
					
					 If the country is not reunified in the present generation, the younger generation will suffer the tragedy of national division and the distrust and confrontation between the north and the south will fester, creating the danger of the nation remaining split into two indefinitely. 
					
					 Only when the country is reunified is it possible to build a rich and powerful, independent and sovereign state on this land and see a paradise for people, a thriving nation to be envied by the world, appear there. 
					
					 It is a natural trend and a law-governed requirement for the development of the national history for the Korean nation to become one as it used to be in the past. 
					
					 Reunification precisely means patriotism and division treachery. It is the only way out to achieve the reunification of the country. If Korea is reunified the country is sure to proudly emerge a rich and powerful, independent and sovereign state in the world arena and the Korean nation will demonstrate its might as a resourceful and dignified great nation.

articles.title: Japan accused of Disallowing Participation in Event by Koreans from China
articles.content:
Japan accused of Disallowing Participation in Event by Koreans from China
 Pyongyang, October 18 (KCNA) -- The South Headquarters of the Pan-national Alliance for Korea's Reunification held a press conference in Seoul on October 15 at which it denounced the Japanese authorities' unreasonable action taken to disallow the participation of  representatives of Koreans from China in an event for reunification.
					 At the press conference speakers denounced the Japanese Ministry of Justice for disallowing the entry into Japan by the said representatives to participate in the meeting of overseas Koreans for defending and implementing the June 15 joint declaration and the October 4 declaration.
					
					 They held the struggle of overseas Koreans to reunify the country divided by foreign forces by the concerted efforts of the Korean nation cannot become a target of interference and suppression by anyone.
					
					 They demanded the Japanese government immediately lift the sanctions against the DPRK and ensure the free visit to the homeland by Koreans in Japan, etc.
					
					 The Solidarity for Progress of south Korea issued a statement on the same day in denunciation of the Japanese authorities' unreasonable suppression of overseas Koreans.

articles.title: S. Korea-U.S. Joint Military Exercise under Fire
articles.content:
S. Korea-U.S. Joint Military Exercise under Fire 
						
Pyongyang, October 18 (KCNA) -- The Solidarity for Implementing the South-North Joint Declaration issued a statement on October 15 denouncing the south Korea-U.S. joint military exercise staged recently.
					 The statement recalled that the U.S. and the south Korean military authorities had staged the joint military exercise since October 13 under the simulated conditions of someone's "infiltration" in the West Sea of Korea with nuclear-powered carrier "George Washington" belonging to the U.S. Seventh Fleet involved.
					
					 This was indication that the U.S. and the south Korean military authorities are busy with the preparations for attacking the north, far from working for dialogue for peace on the Korean Peninsula quite contrary to the trend of the times, the statement noted, and continued:
					
					 The military exercise staged in the West Seat of Korea fraught with the greatest danger of military conflict with the involvement of even the nuclear-powered carrier created the danger of bringing the situation on the Korean Peninsula to the brink of a war again.
					
					 The U.S. unceasing saber rattling is making the Korean issue complicated, it said, urging the U.S. to stop posing threat of a war to the north and positively opt for dialogue for concluding a peace agreement.

articles.title: Congratulatory Visit Paid to DPRK Embassy in Peru
articles.content:
Congratulatory Visit Paid to DPRK Embassy in Peru
Pyongyang, October 18 (KCNA) -- Genaro Ledesma Izquieta, chairman of the People's Front of Workers, Peasants and Students of Peru, paid a congratulatory visit to the DPRK embassy on October 9 on the occasion of the 64th anniversary of the founding of the Workers' Party of Korea.
					 The chairman warmly congratulated the Korean people on the 64th anniversary of the WPK and the 83rd anniversary of the formation of the Down-with-Imperialism Union.
					
					 He said that he was deeply moved to learn about the great achievements made by the Korean people in the struggle to build a thriving nation and reunify the country while foiling the U.S. imperialists' moves for stifling the DPRK under the Songun leadership of Kim Jong Il.
					
					 He stressed that he felt greatly proud and confident of the fact that Kim Jong Il has bolstered up the nuclear deterrent and developed the Korean People's Army into an invincible army to cope with the U.S. imperialists' escalated nuclear threat.

articles.title: Week of Iran-DPRK Friendship Opens in Tehran
articles.content:
Week of Iran-DPRK Friendship Opens in Tehran
 Pyongyang, October 18 (KCNA) -- A week of the Iran-DPRK friendship was opened in Tehran with due ceremony on October 12.
					 Displayed in the venue of the ceremony were photos of President Kim Il Sung meeting with Seyed Ali Khamenei, leader of the Islamic Revolution of Iran, on a visit to the DPRK, works of the peerlessly great persons and books and photos introducing the true appearance of Songun Korea.
					
					 Attending it were political and public figures and other people of Iran.
					
					 Present there on invitation were the DPRK ambassador to Iran, his embassy officials and members of the goodwill delegation of the Korean Committee for Cultural Relations with Foreign Countries.
					
					 The general director for Art and Cultural Cooperation of the Organization of Culture and Islamic Relations of Iran said at the opening ceremony that the meeting of Seyed Ali Khamenei and     Kim Il Sung marked a historic event of epochal significance in the development of the friendly relations between Iran and the DPRK, expressing hope that the joint struggle of the peoples of the two countries for friendship, peace and justice would gain in scope and strength in the future.
					
					 The participants watched Korean film "DPRK Visit Paid by HE Seyed Ali Khamenei, President of the Islamic Republic of Iran".

articles.title: DPRK Important Days Marked in Different Countries
articles.content:
DPRK Important Days Marked in Different Countries
 Pyongyang, October 18 (KCNA) -- Meetings and lectures were held in Bulgaria, Myanmar, Russia, Guinea, Democratic Congo and Indonesia to celebrate the 64th anniversary of the founding of the Workers' Party of Korea and seminars in Pakistan, Mexico, Russia, Uganda, Belarus and Moldova to commemorate the 64th birthday of the WPK and the 83rd anniversary of the formation of the Down-with-Imperialism Union (DIU) from October 1 to 9. 
					Displayed in the venues of the meetings were works of President Kim Il Sung and General Secretary Kim Jong Il and photos introducing their feats.
					
					 Atanas Ivanov, honorary chairman of the Bulgarian Communists Union, said in his speech made at a meeting that the President formed the DIU on October 17, 1926, providing the historic roots of the WPK and founding the WPK on October 10, 1945.
					
					 A member of the Central Executive Committee of the Pakistan People's Party, who is secretary for Information of the Punjab Provincial Committee of the party, noted at a seminar that the WPK has demonstrated its invincible might thanks to the outstanding and tested leadership of General Secretary Kim Jong Il.
					
					 Juan Campos Vega, chairman of the Mexican Institute for the Study of the Juche Idea, stressed that the feats performed by Kim Jong Il in the party building would shine forever. 
					
					The first secretary of the Nakhodka City Committee of the Communist Party of the Russian Federation in a lecture said that Kim Jong Il has turned the DPRK into a great country having powerful nuclear deterrent by enforcing Songun politics. He wished the Korean people greater success in the building of a thriving nation under the leadership of the WPK.
					
					 Messages of greetings to Kim Jong Il were adopted at the meetings held in Bulgaria.

articles.title: Korean Struggle for National Reunification Supported
articles.content:
Korean Struggle for National Reunification Supported 
 Pyongyang, October 18 (KCNA) -- A joint statement was issued on October 9 by delegates of the Communist Party of Cuba, the Communist Party of Brazil, the Peruvian Communist Party, the Communist Party of Colombia, the Communist Party of Bolivia, the Communist Party of Venezuela, the Communist Party of Paraguay, the Communists Party of Mexico, the Communist Party of Argentina and the Communist Party of Chile who participated in the international seminar held in Brazil on the theme of "Prospect of Struggle for Socialism" on the occasions of the 29th anniversary of the proposal for founding the Democratic Federal Republic of Koryo and the second anniversary of the publication of the October 4 declaration.
					 Considering that the communist parties of Latin American countries should positively support and sincerely help the Korean people in their efforts to implement the said proposal and the June 15 North-South Joint Declaration and the October 4 declaration, the statement said:
					
					 We recognize that the proposal for founding the DFRK advanced by President Kim Il Sung indicates the only just way of achieving Korean reunification common to the nation as it helps the Korean people achieve the reunification of their country peacefully in their common interests irrespective of the differing ideology and system in the north and the south.
					
					The October 4 declaration provided thanks to the noble patriotic intention and steadfast will for reunification of General Secretary Kim Jong Il, lodestar of Korea's reunification, serves as an action programme for implementing the June 15 joint declaration which calls for settling the inter-Korean relations and the issue of reunification, guided by the idea of "By our nation itself" and as a banner for independent reunification.
					
					 The communist parties of Latin American countries supporting the reunification of Korea express full support and solidarity with the Korean people in their struggle to achieve the independent and peaceful reunification of the country under the banner of the June 15 North-South Joint Declaration and the October 4 declaration according to the proposal for founding the DFRK.

articles.title: Centenary of Birth of Kim Il Sung to Be Commemorated in Finland
articles.content:
Centenary of Birth of Kim Il Sung to Be Commemorated in Finland
						
 Pyongyang, October 18 (KCNA) -- A Finland Mangyongdae committee was inaugurated in Helsinki with due ceremony on October 10 to commemorate the centenary of birth of President Kim Il Sung.
					 Antti Sika-Aho, chairman of the Finland-Korea Society, was elected chairman of the committee at the ceremony.
					
					 The ceremony discussed the matter of organizing colorful political and cultural events including meeting, seminar and photo exhibition to significantly commemorate the centenary of birth of the President.
